de.jannlab.core

Class CellIntegration

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.core.CellIntegration

  • public final class CellIntegration
extends Object
    This class contains static methods for computing serveral integrations function. An integration function "integrates" data from a source array into a destination array in a specific way. Which value are integrated and where the results are stored is determined by a sequence of links. Thereby, each source value is multiplied with the weight of the link (an non-weighted link has weight 1.0). The overhead of multiplying 1.0 on non-weighted links is much faster than an "if"-check for each weight.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte
    See Also:
    Link

    • Method Detail

      • sum

        public static void sum(double[] src,
       double[] dst,
       int cellsoff,
       int cellsnum,
       double[] weights,
       int[] links,
       int linksoff,
       int linksnum)
        This method computes the weighted sum for the given arguments.

        Parameters:
        src - Refers the source data array.
        dst - Refers the destination data array.
        cellsoff - Refers the lower bound of the destination range.
        cellsnum - Refers the size of the destination range.
        weights - Refers the weights vector.
        links - Refers the links vector.
        linksoff - Gives the offset of the first link according the this current context.
        linksnum - Gives the number of links according to the current context.

      • lastID

        public static void lastID(double[] src,
          double[] dst,
          int cellsoff,
          int cellsnum,
          double[] weights,
          int[] links,
          int linksoff,
          int linksnum)
        This method copies the value of the last source cell of all predecessor cells for each destination cell. This method does not respect weights.

        Parameters:
        src - Refers the source data array.
        dst - Refers the destination data array.
        cellsoff - Refers the lower bound of the destination range.
        cellsnum - Refers the size of the destination range.
        weights - Refers the weights vector.
        links - Refers the links vector.
        linksoff - Gives the offset of the first link according the this current context.
        linksnum - Gives the number of links according to the current context.

        double[] dst,
        int cellsoff,

        This method computes product for the given arguments.

      • perform

        public static void perform(double[] src,
           double[] dst,
           int cellsoff,
           int cellsnum,
           double[] weights,
           int[] links,
           int linksoff,
           int linksnum,
           int integration)
        This methods applies the a integration given by an index for the given arguments. The methods uses a switch block to map to the specific integration function.

        Parameters:
        src - Refers the source data array.
        dst - Refers the destination data array.
        cellsoff - Refers the lower bound of the destination range.
        cellsnum - Refers the size of the destination range.
        weights - Refers the weights vector.
        links - Refers the links vector.
        linksoff - Gives the offset of the first link according the this current context.
        linksnum - Gives the number of links according to the current context.
        integration - Determines the specific integration function.
